text: A COLD WIND blows a bright red scarf tangled high on a st lamp. An iron waste bin is blown sideways into an intersection. stray dog investigates it briefly, urinates and then move A book bag drops onto the pavement. Visible from the waist down, a LARGE YOUNG WOMAN in a disintegrating leather jacket turns the waste bin upright then maneuvers it onto the sidewalk. Once finished, her thick hands wipe each other until they stop abruptly. Here, for the first time, we see her PLUMP, YOUTHFUL, VAC AFRICAN AMERICAN FACE. It is 16-YEAR-OLD PRECIOUS JONES. Something inside the bin has caught her attention. Precious gazes down upon a soiled and tattered paperback as the breath from her nostrils steams. The title of the staring back up at her is unintelligible. She pushes debris aside to get to it. The book plunges deeper into the trash, as if trying to f The sound of an ONCOMING CAR approaches. Precious pins the book against the bottom of the bin as t sounds of the oncoming car close in. Precious finally comes up with the book. Its title is sti unintelligible. When she flips it over, however, the lett on the cover, which are facing us now, make sense. They r CRYSTAL STAIR: SELECTED WORKS BY LANGSTON HUGHES.

The car sounds incredibly close. Precious looks sharply to her left. AN EERIE SKID precedes an eerier THUD! Precious, almost h falls back on to the pavement as her book skips across th intersection and down into a drain. She lays on the sidewalk pressed against the base of the street lamp with her eyes closed. The car reverses, skids, stops for a sec, shifts and SCREECHES off. The garbage bin, overturned yet again, rocks side to side until settling, to a stop. An ambulance eases up to the intersection. When the stoplight changes, the ambulance motors past Precious in no hurry. A moment later, its sirens BLARE an speeds off into the distance. The stray dog returns, re-investigates the garbage bin, a turns to Precious. He licks her face. Tom Cruise walks up her. Precious' still vacant eyes finally open to see Tom, and red scarf falling from the street lamp towards her. Tom g her a hand up.
(flirtatious)
What's your name girl? Precious blushes.
What's your name? Precious still blushing, looks on the ground.
My name is Precious Jones. I wanna take tap dance lessons. Mama said we can't afford it. A SCHOOL BELL RINGS.
The end of a final wave of students head to class.

Plus she say who wanna see me dancing anyway. I goes to I.S. 111. In Harlem. New York. Today I was almost late. That'd a been a problem. Precious scurries behind them donning the red scarf and lugging her book bag.

Precious sits in the last row behind 26 children half her size, 3 years younger and mostly African American. Noise projectiles fill the air. MR. WICHER -A FRAIL MAN IN A BOW TIE AND TWEED COAT, stan at the head of the class trying to establish order.

Class, would you please turn to page 122 ...Class! 122! Precious' book stays closed as the other students find th page. TWO BOYS in front of Precious giggle boisterously at some private joke. Mr. Wicher looks annoyed but accustomed to this.
I like maff but I don't say nuffin' -don't open my book even. Just sit there. The giggling boys continue their shenanigans.
Boys? The boys finally open their books.
Page 122 please.

Everyday I tell myself something gonna happen, like I'm gonna break through or somebody gonna break through to me -I'm gonna learn, catch up, be normal, sit in the front ...someday. The giggling flares up again. Precious sneers at the boys
Today we are going to review Monday's assignment. Would anyone like to begin? The boys get louder.
Mr. Wicher looks at them helplessly.
Boys! ! !

I like Mr. Wicher. I pretend he my husband and we live in Weschesser, whereever that is. I can see by his eyes Mr. Wicher like me too. I wish I could tell him all the pages in my book look the same to me, but I can't..
Excuse you?! The entire class cries, "OOOOOH". Mr. Wicher looks scared

Nobody 'spect us to learn nuffin no way. Now I'm tryin' to have a motherfuckin' conversation back here if you don't mind Mr. Bitcher, I mean, Mr. Wicher. The boys fallout slapping hands. The class turns to Mr. Wicher in unison to see what he wi do.
I want to see you boys after class.
Sorry Mr. Wicher but you ain't my type. Grow some tits.

Just be quiet. Mr. Wicher tries to carry on throughout the boys' unrelen defiance. Other students are continually distracted by th boys. Precious looks bothered the most as Mr. Wicher's so voice loses the battle.
I feels sorry for Mr. Wicher. He do his best but he ain't got no voice. He scared too. I feels sorry for him. The boys break out in RIOTOUS LAUGHTER until ...
CRASH! A desk slams against the floor. The boys whirl aro to see two large hands take hold of them and snatch them of their chairs. Precious has had enough.
Shut up motherfuckers, I'm trying to learn something! Hard enuff wiffout you stupid clowns carryin' on!
(trembling)
...sorry Precious.
(trembling)
We cool. Precious shoves them down in their seats and huffs.
Stupid asses... Go on 'bout cha lesson Mr. Wicher. They ain' gonna give you no more trouble today. Precious turns her desk upright and sits back down. Mr. Wicher looks grateful.
I'm like the polices for Mr. Wicher. Tha's why I can't be late to maff. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK. Someone is outside the classroom. Mr. Wicher waves her inside.

head_text.subj: MRS. LICHENSTEIN, A SKINNY WOMAN IN HER THIRTIES WEARING

text: DARK SKIRT SUIT enters, squints to find Precious, points briefly and then whispers something to Mr. Wicher. Precio rolls her eyes.
Now dis ... Mrs. Lichenstein sends Precious an oversized grin and bec to her.
Claireece ...
Precious sighs.

What this bitch want? Claireece ... Only motherfuckers I hate call me Claireece. Precious gathers her belongings. The other children watch every move in silence. When she reaches the front of the class ...
You gonna be okay Mr. Wicher?
(forcing a smile)

Of course Precious. Thank you. An unconvinced Precious grins sadly as Mrs. Lichenstein motions for Precious to step out ahead of her. Mr. Wicher looks abandoned. The door closing behind Preci might as well be to a prison cell block. Noise inside the classroom returns immediately.
Precious heads off down the wide hallway in silence.
Precious waits among plants, plaques, pictures and file cabinets while Mrs. Lichenstein sits across from her read from a file. Mrs. Lichenstein closes the file and sets it on the desk between them.
Are you pregnant? You're sixteen, still in junior high school and pregnant with your second child. Correct Claireece? Claireece are you pregnant again? Precious stares at the file without responding.
Do you have any thoughts about your situation? Precious shrugs her shoulders.
Claireece?
Precious doesn't respond.
(beat) Claireece, I'm talking to you.
Precious doesn't respond.
Claireece?!
Am I in trouble?
What?
Am I in trouble?
(beat) Then I don't want to miss no more of maff class.
Precious starts to rise.
(firmly) Sit down Claireece.
Precious sits and sighs.
(beat) You know what I think? I think we should have a parent-teacher conference - me, you and your mom.
My muver is busy.
Well maybe I could arrange to come to your house.
My muver wouldn't like that.
Well then Claireece, I'm afraid I'm going to have to suspend you.
For what?
You're pregnant.
That ain't fair. I ain' done nuffin! I doose my work. I ain' in no trouble. My grades is good...
Your attitude is one of total uncooperation and that won't help a thing...
Now I heard everything. Nosy        I'm not the enemy her ass white bitch mad 'cause          h there's something going on at

she can't come over my house.        ome that you would l I don't be coming to this           talk about, you shoul bitch's house in Weschesser.        free to do so here. I I'll be damned. I done heard        find that the added s everything. White bitch wanna       caring for your child visit. Then I thought about         affecting your concen Mr. Wicher all alone up             that would be helpful against the fools in his maff       know. class ...
Now according to our records, your mother also looks after the child. Is that correct?
No kids on her pictures. Maybe she jealous. I still don't say nuffin.
Are you in contact with the father? (beat) Is he at all involved in your child's care?
No answer.
Fine! If that's the way you wanna play it, we can do this all day. The hand on Precious' lap makes a fist.

Thas when I knew I'd never get back to maff class ...Lawd I hate this hoe. Precious lunges from her chair and reaches over the desk. Mrs. Lichenstein vaults backwards in terror and tumbles t the floor.
Precious bursts out of Mrs. Lichenstein's office and walk the exit. Mrs. Lichenstein's distant voice still cries fo security.
Precious heads down the hall without looking back. Mrs. Lichenstein's CRIES are still audible.
A faucet runs. Precious stands over the sink washing dishes. A moment la a WOMAN'S VOICE speaks over the sound of a TELEVISION.
You get my cigarettes? Precious freezes. Her HEART BEATS loudly.
(delicately)
No Mama, I dropped some of my thangs on the way to school. A SCREECHING CAR echoes distantly.
DRESS sits on the couch with her back turned to Precious. This woman looks as if she is one with the furniture.

A cigarette smolders between her fingers as she watches " PRICE IS RIGHT" on television. Precious, still waiting for the other shoe to drop, looks momentarily relieved and returns to the dishes until ...
A thick glass ashtray smashes into Precious' head. Precious falls and lands ...
...onto a bed completely naked.

head_text.subj: CARL KENWOOD JONES, A LARGE AND NAKED MAN MUCH MORE THAN

text: TWICE HER AGE falls on top of her and gyrates. Moments later...
(softly)

Daddy? An enormous hand muzzles her. Precious lays there impassively as her vacant eyes fixate a long crack in the ceiling. As we drift towards the crack it seems to widen -to open another world where...

Blinding flashbulbs pop everywhere. Precious walks the red carpet with Tom Cruise. They head toward the entrance of the theatre stopping occasionally sign autographs. Both sport matching sunglasses. The paparazzi is going wild. THUNDER RUMBLES. Precious removes her sunglasses and sear the sky. A LIGHTENING CRACK ROARS. Rain starts to fall as ...
Drops of water seep from the crack in the ceiling accompa by the sound of distant THUNDER and MASCULINE GRUNTS morp into...
(at the top of her lungs)

head_text.subj: I SAID I'M HONGRY YOU FAT LITTLE

text: PIGGY CUNT BITCH!!! Git your Jezebel ass up and git to dinner 'fore I give you something to cry about.

Eyes closed with ashes and tears on her face, Precious la still on the floor. Her hands are still wet from the dish GOOOSH! 2 gallons of water splash down on her. Her eyes spring open. Mary stands over Precious with a large dripping pot in he hands. She drops it on the floor and returns to the couch watch another program.
...I ain' gon' say it again.
Pots and pans sizzle on the stove. Precious, now wearing a dry T-shirt, tends to dinner meticulously until ... ANNNNT! The sharp sound of a BUZZER rings. Mary and Precious turn to the door in unison.
Tell them assholes to stop ringing my bell. Here is our first good look at Mary. She wares way too mu make up. Precious wipes her hands and heads for the door though Ma sits much closer to it.
No one ever ring the bell but crack addicts. I hates crack addicts. Give the ghetto a bad name.
Precious presses TALK on the intercom.
Stop ringing the goddam buzzer motherfucker!
Precious heads back to the dishes until ... ANNNT! The buzzer again. Precious returns to the intercom.
Stop ringing the goddam buzzer.
Stop it!
Stop it!
Press LISTEN stupid.
Precious sighs and presses LISTEN.
It's Sondra Lichenstein for Claireece and Ms. Mary Johnston.
Precious' face goes blank. Mary looks alarmed and mutes t television.
Who that Precious?
White bitch from school.
Mrs. Lichenstein stands by the buzzer bundled up. THUMPIN RAP MUSIC FROM A CAR passes behind her.
She bounces lightly to the beat.
Lord, where is crack addicts when you need 'em...
Precious and Mary still try to sort this out.
What she want?
I don't know.
Ask her stupid. Precious presses TALK.
What you want? Precious presses LISTEN.
I want to talk to you about your education.
Eighty-six that bitch. Precious looks unsure.

A young man exits the building smoking a cigarette. Mrs. Lichenstein puts her hands together, dramatically pleads a smoke and gets one. She puts it in her mouth and lights hers to his. Bouncing stay warm, she nods in gratitude as the man walks off.
This bitch crazy. 'Sides, my muver don't want to get cut off welfare and that's what Mrs. Lichenstein comin' to visit result in. It's hard to believe a hoe dis retarded sposed to educate somebody.
Precious presses TALK.
Git outa here Mrs. Lichenstein 'fore I kick your ass.
Precious presses LISTEN.
Claireece I am so sorry about today. I only want to help you. I ...Mr. Wicher says you're one of his best students and that you have an aptitude for math -or at least potential. (beat)
I've called a Mrs. McKnight at Higher Education Alternative / Each One Teach One. It's an alternative school. (beat)
Claireece, are you listening? Precious looks at her mother. Mary clearly finds this all bizarre.
Claireece, did you hear me? Precious presses TALK.
Yeah. Precious presses LISTEN.
I've called Ms. McKnight at Each One Teach One. It's located on the nineteenth floor of the Hotel Theresa on 125th Street. That's not too far from here. Precious presses TALK.
I know where that is. Precious releases the button.
Bitch.
Precious presses LISTEN.
The phone number is 555-0831. I told them about you. Call or drop in, nineteenth floor.
I heard you the first time.
Listen Claireece... If you go down tomorrow.... Look, they have just started their semester. You may be a day or 2 late... Give it a try.
Mrs. Lichenstein bounds off into the night with her cigarette.
I don't know what an alternative school is but I feel I want to know...
Precious leans against the refrigerator glowing.
My heart is all warm...Mr. Wicher say I'm a good student.

There is silent movement behind Precious. Mary approaches quietly wielding a skillet. Mary swings for a head shot but Precious easily sidesteps blow. The refrigerator takes the hit and a new dent. Precious stares calmly at her mother. Mary almost looks ashamed. Still aglow, Precious grins absently at her mother and th leaves the kitchen.
Mary watches her go and then struts back to the televisio speaking to herself.
School can't help none. Go down welfare. Who she think she is?
(beat)

Think she cute now right? Shoulda kept her mouf shut. Uppity now cause he give her more childrens than he did me. Should've kept her damn mouf shut. Stupid little pig. Who she think she is? What I'm sposed to do for cig'rettes now?
Precious, now dressed for bed and still beaming, pulls th covers to her chest.
The sun rises into the sky. The shadow of a tree draws shorter as does that of an open gate.

The clock on the night stand reads 8:29. We drift back to find Precious sitting on the side of her fully dressed with neon yellow leggings and her red scarf she stares at the clock. Various sheets of colored construction paper display Precious' handprints on the wall. Their sizes increase progressively and end beside a poster of Cyndi Lauper. When the clock reads 8:30, Precious stands, looks in a mirror, sees a pretty blond white girl and leaves the roo
Precious heads for the front door.
Where you going? DUNK, CLINK, CLONK, CLANK -Precious opens 4 locks with sw precision.
You hear me talking to you?! Precious leaves slamming the door behind her.
We track with Precious as she exits her building. RUBY, A

head_text.subj: DARK-SKINNED HEAVY-SET LITTLE GIRL WITH A "NATURAL" HAIRS

text: WHO COULD EASILY PASS FOR A YOUNGER PRECIOUS, trails Precious. A naked blond armless Barbie doll dangles by it hair from Ruby's hand.
Precious when we gon' play?
(without turning around)
Ain' you s'posed to be in school?
You said we was gon' play.
See, thas jus exackly why we ain' gon' be playin'. I never said nuffin like it.
Why not?
Cause you a mess. Look at ya' -no style, no friends, no mama, no daddy.
So?! I ain' the only one. Precious stops abruptly and turns around.
What you say?!
...nuffin.
Thas what I thought. Precious heads away into the distance.
I check in wif you tomorrow Precious.
You do that.
Precious walks gazing upward. Street lamps pass beneath the sky as autumn leaves fall f nowhere.
I'm lookin' up. Lookin' out for a piano to fall, a desk, couch, TV, Mama maybe? Always somethin' in the way. Alternative. I'm gon' see all about it.
Watch where you goin' Orca! Precious looks down to find three skinny boys, each much smaller than she, taunting her.
Then my mind come back down to Earf.
Shut up fool, she gon' eat you. The boys burst out in laughter slapping hands and grabbin their crotches.

Boyz always been little things that laff and grab they selves -cept for when I's real big and pregnant wif my first baby. Then boyz don't say nuffin. They stand out the way real quiet like I'm Queen of England... Pointing at her leggings, the boys erupt some more.
Still, I wonder...what could I wear that boyz don't laff? Precious crashes to the ground. The boys look surprised a moment and then howl harder than ever.
I always be fallin like that when my mind be wanderin. Mama say I gonna fall to my death one day. Wonder what that be like?
The boys continue to taunt her from above. Precious stare into space as if they aren't there.

Precious in Black leotards, fishnet stockings and patent leather shoes tap dancing away. She finishes her number a Tom Cruise walks into frame clapping. Tom gives her a hug a friendly lick on the ear.
Precious continues to stare into space as a dog licks on ear.
Precious walks amongst a crowd of people and stops to sta at the Hotel Theresa, a beautiful pre-war building.

Precious enters the lobby. An older black man in a blue uniform sits in a chair reading the Daily News through th glasses. He doesn't move, react, speak to or look at Precious as s passes him. Precious glances back at him as she reaches the elevators presses the button and waits. The elevator doors open. Precious steps inside and turns around. Her eyes widen and time slows down. The sound of rises. Moments later, Precious snaps out of her daze and hastily pushes button 19. The doors close.
Precious rises....5....8....14....15....and.... DING! 19. The elevator doors fly open.
Precious steps out to find an AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMAN IN H EARLY 30'S WEARING HER HAIR IN "CORNROWS". She sits behind a desk while speaking on the phone.

Why do you say that shit when you don't mean it Trey? I'm not playing with you and I know that wasn't your damn sister neither....because you don't have one...Fine. Yeah, whatever. Cornrows slams the phone down, mumbles and looks over a f
This the alternative?
(looking up)
The what?
This the alternative?
What exactly are you looking for?
(pointing)
Well what is this here?
This is Higher Education Alternative / Each One Teach One.
I'm looking for alternative school.
This is an alternative school.
What alternative is?
What are you asking me?
Alternative. The lady from my other school tell me to come here to Hotel Theresa, nineteenth floor, it's "alternative" school.
Each One Teach One is an alternative school and an alternative school is like a choice, a different way to do something.
Oh.
You need your discharge papers from your old school saying they have formally discharged you or we can't allow you in the program.
I got kicked out 'cause I was pregnant.
You still need formal discharge papers or we can't let you in. It's the law.
Mrs. Lichenstein ain' say all that.
Oh you're the one Mrs. Lichenstein called about.
What she say?
(searching papers) Are you Claireece P. Jones?
Thas me.
Well the principal at I.S. 111 already sent your discharge papers and stuff over.
What stuff?
Your academic record. Suddenly, Precious looks very concerned.
Are you all right? Precious looks both angry and disappointed.
I thought this was new start. File and tesses chase me to the grave.
Claireece?
Huh?
We had to have certain information before we could accept you into the program. So really, their sending your records over was just a way of speeding things up for you.
Can I start today?
Yup. The only other thing we need right now is income verification. Are you currently receiving AFDC?
No...My muver get AFDC for me and my daughter.
Oh, you've had amniocentesis?
Huh?
You said your mother has custody of you and your daughter?
Not this baby! I got another one 'sides this coming.
Oh I see. Your mother has custody of you and your daughter so you're on her budget. Precious nods.
Okay, well I need a copy of your mother's budget and a current phone or utilities bill, okay?
I got to go get all that now?
No, relax. We're just gonna give you a few tests -test your reading and math level, see where to place you.
What's the difference?
Well, to enter G.E.D. classes a student should be able to read on an eighth-grade level. They should score 8.0 or better on the TABE reading test.
I was in ninfe grade at I.S. Ill.
(smiling)
Then you should have no problem. Precious doesn't look as convinced.
Precious neatly writes CLAIREECE P. JONES on the top of t page.
Precious sits alone behind a smattering of empty desks in bright classroom. She looks over her test, exhales and starts to write.
A TICKING CLOCK accompanies ... ...misspelled words ...eraser shreds ...tapping feet ...sweat ...giant letters ...tapping thumb ...tapping pencil ...frowns ...giant numbers ...eraser shreds ...sighs
Precious looks up sharply. A square fluorescent light in the ceiling blinks and buzz as if struggling to stay alive. We tilt down from the blinking light to find that we are different place ...
A YOUNGER PRECIOUS with uncombed hair sits with her back us in a bright pink dress. She is at the very back of the classroom.

The many children seated in front of her are all blurs th gradually fade into darkness while raising their hands. As we drift towards young Precious, the stains on her dre become more apparent. As we continue drifting, the PLAYGROUND VOICES OF OTHER Y CHILDREN ECHO out...
...What that on your dress Precious?
She don't say nuffin'. She don't talk to nobody.
She nasty.
When the last time yo head was combed? Precious mumbles something to herself.
...What?! Shut up Precious. You talk funny. You was better when you was on mute.
Here come the wide load... Boys makes a lengthy FARTING sound triggering a CHORUS OF LAUGHTER. Our drift finally lands on a puddle of urine at her feet.
Teacher! Teacher! Precious peeded herself again! GIGGLES fill the air. A small pencil falls into the puddl making a large ripple.
Precious' pencil point has broken but she still holds the pencil as if about to write.
Precious sits with an absent look on her face and a bead sweat on her temple. A moment later, a shadow moves over test.
Claireece, do you need another pencil? The administrator stands over Precious waiting for an ans
Claireece ... Precious looks up to her blankly.
Are you finished? Precious nods absently. The administrator gently takes the test from Precious' de and leaves. Precious lingers pensively in the back of the room.
There has always been something wrong wif the tesses ...
Precious walks with her hands in her pockets watching the pavement pass beneath her.

...The tesses paint a picture of me wif no brain. The tesses paint a picture of me 'an my muver -my whole family as less than dumb just ugly black grease to be wiped away, punished, caged up, kilt, changed, finded a job for. Precious leaves us behind.
Sometimes I wish I was not alive. I be O.K. I guess.
...A hand shuts off a shower . ...A toothbrush lands in a mug .

...A hairbrush lands on a dresser. ...Thick hands remove a red scarf from a drawer. ...The clock on the night stand reads 8:29. Precious sits on the side of her bed fully dressed with r leggings and her red scarf staring at the clock with a notebook in her hands.
Today is first day. I been tessed. I been incomed eligible. I got my medicaid card, proof of address, self, pencil, notebook -alla dat shit.
When the clock reads 8:30, she stands, turns to a mirror, sees a pretty blond white girl and leaves the room.
...Precious stares into the refrigerator. ...Precious stares into the freezer. Finally, she closes the door.
MA! !!
No answer.
MA! !!
What?!
I need some money.
For what?
Sumthin' to eat. My head hurt.
(beat) How much you need?
Five dollars.
(beat) Come and git it then.
The air changes. Time stands still. A look that is both childlike and gray comes over Preciou face.
Large panties fall to the floor from beneath the sheets. Mary's knees widen beneath the covers.
A frozen Precious stares across the apartment for a brief eternity. Finally, she dashes for the front door, throws open the l and bolts out of the apartment slamming the door behind h
Where you going?!
Precious walks briskly.
The other day I cried, felt stupid. Guess what...Fuck that other day. Thas why God or whoever make new days. Still hungry tho.
Precious stops and looks up at something. Before her stands a fast food restaurant with a giant sig atop it that says KICKIN FRIED CHICKEN. Precious looks around, takes a deep breath and steps insi
Precious approaches the counter with a strained "nonchalance". A MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN IN A HAIR-NET waits behind the regist Precious sets her notebook and pencil down on the nearest table.
What you want baby?
Give me a basket please.
Sides? Precious' eyes wander from the fry bin all the way over t refrigerator towards the back.

Ain't sure. still thinkin'. Watchin' the weight you know. The woman chuckles and then leaves for the chicken. The digital clock on the wall reads 8:53. Precious whirls around to see A YOUNG MAN CIGARETTE IN HI MOUTH spraying the door with glass cleaner and then wipin from the bottom up. Precious turns back around to find her server selecting pieces of chicken from a huge tray with large silver tong The clock on the wall reads 8:54. Precious turns to the door again to find the young man st cleaning it. Precious turns back around to see her server returning wi basket of chicken.
Potato salad! Thas it. The woman nods, sets the chicken on the counter and heads back towards the refrigerator in one fluid motion.
The young man wipes the top of the front door and looks t about finished.
Precious bursts out of the restaurant with the bucket und one arm and sprints off down the block. A SCREAM from inside follows.

A second later, Reggie, the young man who cleaned the gla dashes out after Precious. Precious looks back while sprinting and scarfing down pie of chicken at a remarkable rate. Across the street, SHEILA, Reggie's pregnant girlfriend, screams at him.
Reggie, where you been? I've been paging your tired ass all night. Reggie stops dead in his tracks. Shit! Busted. He lights cigarette, about faces and prepares for her rant.

Nigga, I knew that was you. And who you running after, some fat bitch. Get your ass over here. Precious turns the corner of 126th street and onto Clayto Powell Jr. Boulevard still devouring chicken. A SKINNY DISHEVELED MAN sitting on a standpipe calls out her.
You gon catch indigestion Mommie.
Precious finishes off the chicken at the exact moment she reaches the Hotel, stuffs the bones and basket into a tra bin and dashes into the building.
Precious looks at her watch and then freezes as if someth terrible has just dawned on her.
Precious' notebook and pencil sit on the table where she them.
Precious looks crestfallen. A glance at her watch makes i worse.
Her stomach GROWLS. She suddenly looks unwell.
The elevator doors open. Cornrows speaks on the phone whi picking her nails. Several lines are ringing. She waves f behind her desk as Precious walks by.
(on the phone)
...What else would get away with clouding your mind, messin your heart and leaving the goddamn toilet seat up? Wait a minute girl.... She decides to grab a line.
Each One Teach one, hold please. She pushes another line.
Each One Teach One, hold. She goes back to her conversation.
Yeah, I'm back. Precious exits.
Precious, nauseous, makes her way down the hallway.

location: HOTEL THERESA HALLWAY OUTSIDE MS. RAINS ROOM -

text: Precious lunges for a trash bin into which she promptly vomits. She quickly catches her breath. Wipes her mouth and looks feet away at a brightness coming from an open doorway. He HEART BEATS loudly. Precious stands up. She seems to be there for a considera spell. A blur of a young girl darts into the room from the other of the hall without looking at her.

head_text.subj: MS. RAIN, PETITE, AFRICAN AMERICAN, BEAUTIFUL, THIRTIES,

text: ALERT EYES enters the hallway looking at her watch and th up to Precious.
You alright? Precious doesn't respond.
Are you in the A.B.E. class?
Yes.
This is it. Ms. Rain looks at her watch, beckons Precious with one ar and disappears inside.
Time's a wastin'.
Precious still doesn't move. Ms. Rain appears again.
You in or you out? This door closes in thirty seconds. Ms. Rain disappears again. Precious' feet finally transport her into the bright door Its blinding light envelopes her completely.
Ms. Rain's desk sits before six smaller ones situated in semi-circle. Four of them are occupied by girls roughly Precious' age:

head_text.subj: RHONDA JOHNSON -AFRICAN AMERICAN, STOCKY AND EVEN TALLER
PRECIOUS, RITA ROMERO -LATIN DESCENT, MEDIUM BUILD, FRIEN
FACE AND DRESSED ENTIRELY IN BLACK, JERMAINE HICKS WIRY,

First thing I wonder is where is everybody -the boyz, the noises ...this feel like a Sunday school or crazy house...or something like bof' but different. Smell different too. Precious' eyes land on the lone desk in the rear of the r
Have a seat. Precious looks from the distant desk to one up front and back to the distant desk. She sits with the other girls delicately, as if she were visitor in a complete stranger's home.
Ms. Rain finishes marking the roll sheet, places the cap her pen and holds up a notebook identical to the one Prec left at the Kickin Fried Chicken.

Does everyone have her notebook? Precious sucks her teeth in self-disgust as she looks aro to find that all the other girls have theirs. JO ANN ROGERS -CAREFREE, CUTE AND SMUG, then breezes into room with an air of insubordination.
It's 9:07. Jo Ann you're late. Jo Ann points into her mouth, which is full.
(chewing)
I had to. Most important meal of the...
Starting tomorrow, this door will be locked at 9:00. Jo Ann rolls her eyes and sits beside Precious.
Class, today we have some new people so let's just...

It's mine!
Okay hoe. I found your Cadillac too. It's parked out front.
Jo Ann rolls her eyes.
I leff it! I did! I leff it at the Kickin Fried Chicken on Lenox tween one-two-seven and one-two-six this morning.
...Alright girl, I was just fuckin' with you. Jo Ann returns the notebook to Precious.
Mind your mouth in here Jo Ann.
What I say?!
Just watch the language. Jo Ann shrugs her shoulders, looks down and then turns he eyes to Precious' stomach.
(quietly)
When you due? Precious looks down and shrugs her shoulders.

Since we have more new people than old people today, let's just go back to square one and get to know each other. State your name, where you were born, your favorite color, something you do well and why you're here.
What?! Ms. Rain points to the blackboard where each of the 5 questions are written neatly to the side.
I'll start. My name is Blu Rain ...
What?!
Thas your real name?
That's my for real, hope to die if I'm lying name.
Your first name Blue?
Yes it is. My favorite color is purple...

Off da bat sumthin' different wif dis lady. She like to sing. I wish I could sing. Go to church. Sing on a choir. Mama say ain't no God. Dis lady remind me Mr. Wicher but more a man and like Miss Lichenstein 'cept not a cuckoo. Dress like she ride in out the village too.

...What do I do well? I sing pretty well. And I'm here because a good friend used to teach at this school. She was out one day and asked me to substitute for her. When she quit, they asked me if I wanted the job. I said yes and I've been here ever since. Rhonda?
My name Rhonda Patrice Johnson. I was born in Kingston Jamaica ... Precious looks her over.

Big redbone girl big like me      My favorite color is bl but don't talk funny like how     I cook good. My mother coconut head peoples do.          have a restaurant on Se Ave. Before she got sick, she taught me everything. I'm here to bring up my reading so I could get my G.E.D.

My name is Rita Romero. I was born right here in Harlem. I'm here because I was an addict and dropped out of school ...

The first part. Precious is next.
Claireece? Precious doesn't respond.
Claireece?
(softly)
Could I skip too Miz Rain?

Certainly. Jo Ann? Precious exhales looking astoundingly grateful and then t to Jo Ann.
I'm Jo Ann. (waving enthusiastically)
Hi! My favorite color is fluorescent beige. My ambition is to have my own record layer. Ms. Rain and the class look confused.
Where were you born and why are you at this school?

Jo Ann like the spotlight and   I was born in King's Coun can't sit still. Teacher        Hospital. My mother moved don't need no outside           to Harlem when I was nine policin' tho. Well, that's everyone. Welcome to...
I could...Could I...go? Surprised, Ms. Rain and the class turn to Precious. She i visibly uncomfortable and seems as if trying to hide in p sight.
Okay Claireece. The air is sucked out of the room.
Everybody looking at me now. Everybody see me. I wish for back of class again... The distant desk vanishes over Precious' shoulder.
...then I think, never that again. Precious exhales.
My name Claireece Precious Jones. I go by Precious. I was born in Harlem. I like yellow 'n I had a problem at my old school so I come here.
(beat)
Something you do well? Precious thinks for a moment and then shrugs.
...Nuffin.
(softly)
Everybody is good at something. Precious shakes her head.
One thing?
(looking down)
I can cook and... The room waits.
And?
I never... The room continues to wait.
Well ...I never talked in class before. I guess now I could do that too.
(beat)
How does it make you feel? Precious looks around but seems to be searching inside mo than anywhere else. After a moment...
...Here. It make me feel ...here. The class is quietly taken aback. Precious smiles as if having just made it ashore from a s lost at sea.
Precious walks off alone still beaming from the new world has discovered.      P

Before, I got A minus in English and never say nuffin', never do nuffin'. But Miz Rain say we gonna read and write in our notebooks every day. Thas sumthin' seeing how we can't really do none of those things and then I think maybe this ain' tha class for me. But when Miz Rain see the worry on my face, she look at me and start to talk in Chinese... The ghostly image of Ms. Rain appears on the sidewalk ahe of Precious. It is a glimpse from back in the classroom. voice ECHOES.
The longest journey begins with a single step...
Ms. Rain vanishes and Precious shakes her head.
...Whatever the fuck that spozed to mean. This school different, okay. But this not Star Trek neitha'.
Precious continues into the distance.
Complicated, complicated -Chinese journeys, 2 books, write 'n you don't know how? Dawg ...

Ms. Rain writes the letter A on the board and then hands chalk to Jermaine. Jermaine writes B and then hands it to Consuelo. Consuelo writes C and hands it to Rhonda. Rhond writes D and hands it to Rita. Rita takes a step and starts to cry. She drops the chalk. shatters on the floor.
We're all in this together Rita. Class?
E!

Rita picks up the largest shard of chalk from the floor a writes E on the board. She hands the chalk to Precious an Precious writes F. The entire class sits simultaneously and then giggles at their synchronicity.

This is just the beginning. Why don't we try by ourselves? There are 26 letters in the alphabet. They all have a sound. These letters make up all the words in our language. Please open your notebooks, write the date and then let's write the alphabet.
The girls begin to write.
Precious soon sets her pencil down, moves her hands to he stomach and looks faint. She gathers herself, catches her breath and trudges on.
This is going to be painless ...
Precious and Ms. Rain sit close together over a small tab looking down at a large colorful children's book.
...I just want you to read a page from this book. Precious looks up at her blankly and then back down at th book with trepidation.
Sure lady, right after I get voted president.
Precious?
I can't do that Miz Rain.
C'mon Precious. Give it a try. Precious looks mortified and starts breathing heavily.

head_text.subj: DOOR SLAMS, MOANS, PANTING, PLATES BREAKI
MEAT SIZZLING, ZIPPERS, GRUNTS, SQUEAKING BED SPRINGS,

text: LAUGHTER, SCREAMS, A RAZOR SLICING YOUNG FLESH, SWEAT and DAYTIME TELEVISION all assault her mind's senses. Ms. Rain speaks with a dire look of concern on her face b no words come out. She places a hand on Precious' shoulder and the kaleidosc of sounds sucks away into the air. The words from Ms. Rai mouth finally register.
Precious. Honey are you okay? Try to relax. Should I call an ambulance? 911? Your moth ...
Ms. Rain jumps.
What is it?
The pages ... Ms. Rain looks down perplexed.
(defeated)
They all look alike to me. Always did.
(beat)
The words or the pictures?

The words. Ms. Rain sighs. She sits back for a moment and looks as i she's processing more than just the tragedy of this particular situation but what is that of countless others In a decisive, almost militaristic movement, Ms. Rain sit again.
I think I understand you Precious but I still want you to try. You're going to have to push yourself. Precious looks back down at the page. There are people of various colors on a beach.
What do you think the story is about?
Peoples at the beach?
That's right. Ms. Rain points to the letter A. It is the first word on page.
Do you know what that is?
Yes. A. Ms. Rain points to the next word.
Do you know that word?
No. I don't.
Do you know the letters. Precious nods. Ms. Rain points to the letters ...
Do you know that word? Precious shakes her head.
Day. That word is day. Ms. Rain points to the next word.
What's that word?
Ate.
Good! Almost! The word is 'at'. Ms. Rain points at the next word.
The! Ms. Rain points to the next word.
...Beach?
'Shore'. That   word is 'shore'. That's almost   like 'beach'. Very good. Can you   read the whole thing?
Precious nods.

A-Day-at-the-Shore. Amazed the words that escaped were from her very own mout Precious' jaw drops. She whirls to Ms. Rain. Ms. Rain smiles. We ease away from the office as the two of them continue working down the page.
Precious enters the apartment. Mary sits on the couch watching "THE COSBYS."
Bring your fat ass in here! Precious suddenly looks exhausted.
Where you sneak your ass off to this morning? Precious doesn't respond.
You hear me talking to you! Where you sneak your ass off to this morning?!
School! I was at school!
You lying whore!
Am not!
You is! The welfare done called here, saying they is removing you from my budget 'cause you not in regular attendance in school.
Mama, I tole you I got kicked out. I been home mostly every day for two weeks.
You didn't say nothin' `bout no damn school today.
Mama, I tole you dis morning I was goin'to school.
At a loss but still angered, Mary turns back to the television slowly. Precious starts for her room until...
I ain' had no breakfast.
Precious stops, sighs, heads to the sink and starts washi her hands. Mary talks to Precious while watching television.
...Need to forget school. Need to git your ass on down to welfare.
Precious dries her hands and reaches for a pan.
I'm gonna get stipend for school and then...
Fool fuck a stipend. What's that? I said take your ass down to welfare.
Precious stops everything with the pan in her hand.
Now?
No stupid. Got to be there at 7 in the A.M. if you gonna talk to anybody...
Precious shakes her head, huffs and turns on the stove. M then presses the mute button on the remote and whirls aro with a cold cigarette between her fingers.
-Oh you too good for that? Is that what you is now, too good for welfare? (beat)

More white folks on 'ssistance than there is niggas Miss Onassis. Other ones got trust fund welfares from 'sploitin po dumb asses like yo dumb ass for centuries ...Man on TV say let's end 'Firmative Action. Fine wit me. And while we at it, let's take out son-in-laws, country clubs, white motherfuckers and then call it a day. Precious turns to her mother looking surprised but pensiv Mary's eyes are still fixed on the TV.
Now hurry yo ass up. I'm gon die of starvation over here. Then where you be at then?
A picturesque plate of pork chops and mashed potatoes. Precious delivers it to the couch with a fork and knife.

head_text.subj: THE APARTMENT HAS TRANSFORMED INTO THE PRISTINE WORLD OF

text: TV SITCOM THEY WERE WATCHING. Precious and Mary are well- dressed and done-up like TV stars.
What you gon' have?
I ain' hungry. I ...
Yes you is.
But Mama I ...
Sit your ass down. Precious sighs and joins Mary on the couch. Mary hands Precious the plate and silverware.
Jus make mine after you done. This gon' get cold if it sit.
But I thought you said you was hongry?
Do what I say don't say what I say. Now eat bitch!
Precious starts eating slowly. Mary lights her cigarette.
...Best feed like a pig and not a cow so's you can git yo ass back to the stove. If I croak off starvation, where in the world you be at then?
Precious eats reluctantly.

Pots and pans sit drying on the counter. Precious wipes her hands on a dishcloth. The room is quiet and empty now. Precious stares blankly out of the window. ...She goes to the television, presses the remote and sit down. "THE COSBYS" is still on. Tired and full, she turns TV off. She watches Mary's face snoring rhythmically but extremely unpleasant noises. Finally, she backs away and to her bedroom.

Precious falls back across her bed with her arms spread. She stares up at the crack in her ceiling... A hand darts into frame, touches Precious' side and then quickly withdraws. Precious ignores it. The hand returns another jab. Precious restrains a grin. Finally the hand tickles her fiercely.

She giggles uncontrollably. The hand belongs to Tom Cruis He wears a leather jacket with a cherry red motorcycle he tucked under one arm. The helmet has a golden bow stuck o its crown. ...Precious chases him out of frame for some revenge tick as they both laugh quietly. ...The helmet falls to the floor with a bounce.
...Claireece, would you like to talk about your home life?

Precious sits on a small couch in a modest office contain 2 bookshelves, several plaques and 2 file cabinets. MS. WEISS -40's, CAUCASIAN, CONSERVATIVELY DRESSED sits across from Precious with a clipboard on her lap and glas low on her nose. A strap hangs down from the glasses and snakes around the back of her neck.
What do you want me to say?
Whatever comes to mind when you think about your home.
Seem like inquiring white bitches always want to know.
I wish I had a TV in my room.
(beat)
Is that all?
No... My muver is a like a whale person for the couch. She says I eat alla time, but then she always makin' me eat... and then call me a fat mess.... She says apartment is little because of me.
She only leaves the house to play the number. Sometimes I feel I could just sit there wif her everyday wif the shades drawed, watch TV, eat, watch TV, eat. Can we talk about something else now?
Of course. I want to learn more about your father anyway.
I don't know much more than you do Miz White...
Weiss.
He say he the original man like Farrakhan be saying but little do he know about it. He give me this baby comin and my other one before. Thas all I know. Don't see him. Don't need to I guess.
(quickly) What did you say your father gave you?
(catching herself) ...Nuffin.
Yes you did Claireece. You said your father gave you...
No I didn't neitha. If you heard that, then you heard sumthin' else cause I ain' said nuffin like it!
Ms. Weiss' wariness looks unmoved.
Now whas next?
Um...How about your first child? You haven't spoken much about her...
Precious turns to Ms. Weiss. A DOORBELL RINGS ...

head_text.subj: TOOSIE, A WOMAN IN HER LATE 50'S RADIATING A TOUGHNESS OF

text: GENERATIONS, enters the apartment in a business-like mann

head_text.subj: MONGO, A SMALL, DISTRACTED AND OBVIOUSLY HANDICAPPED CHIL

text: Toosie has a bag of groceries in her other arm. Precious watches TV beside her mother. Both appear as if they've just woken up. Mary attempts to put on her wig an make up. Toosie gives Mongo to Mary, whose eyes never leave the television, and then hands the groceries to Precious, who takes them directly to the kitchen as Toosie leaves witho word.
Mongo?
Excuse me?
Mongo? Thas short for Mongoloid. She got Down Sinder.
You mean she has Down Syndrome?

Alla dat. The child seems only mildly aware of what is going on. The DOORBELL rings again. Precious opens the door. A HISP WOMAN IN HER THIRTIES with an attache case enters. As the woman steps inside, we see that Mary has finished tidying herself. Mary and the woman exchange small talk while Precious listens. Mary has never seemed so congenial.

My grandmuver Toosie, brangs Little Mongo over on days social worker come so it look like Mongo live wif us. Then my mama get the check 'n food stamps for me 'n Little Mongo. But it's my baby. Little Mongo is money for me, not her!
Precious continues speaking to Ms. Weiss from the couch.
...Sometimes I see vampires too. They come for me sometimes and they say that I am one of them. They say, "Precious, you belong wif us."
How do you respond to them?

I say, "Check wif my muver." After that, they just look at me and go down through the floor. The family downstairs is vampires so that's where they should go. Ms. Weiss looks up from her clipboard and over her glasse Precious reflects a moment and then looks up.

I'm going to the doctor now too. It's nice. Miz Rain, she fall out when she finded out that I ain' been to no doctor. Whole class scream 'preenatal' at me. They don't know I had my first baby on the kitchen floor wif my muver kicking me upside my head. I mean, who would believe? Precious snickers reminiscently a moment and then turns t Ms. Weiss.
Them the kind of thangs you mean when you say talk about whatever come into my mind? Ms. Weiss looks up and nods through a perplexed daze.
Precious rides lost in thought.
I still don't know why I said all them thangs. I know I wasn't s'posed to. Just tired.
Tired of lying I guess. Hope mama don't find none of it out. She kill me for real cause that be tha end of them welfare checks.
The girls burst into frame followed by Ms. Rain and Cornr and then bound up a large number of steps leading into TH METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART.

location: METROPOLITAN MUSEUM PERMANENT EGYPTIAN ART COLL

text: Led by a spirited guide and trailed by Ms. Rain and Cornr the girls scrutinize colossal tombs, various artifacts, hieroglyphics and photographs.
Miz Rain brang us out to see some real old stuff. Thangs and stuff before TV's was made, before Mr. Abraham Lincoln, before Miz Harriet Tubman -maybe some stuff before Miz Weiss even.
Precious and Rita fearfully enter the Tomb of Perneb. 2 s in, Rita grabs Precious hand tightly.
Before we turn tha corner in a mummy tomb, Rita grab hold of my hand. No one in my life ever do that. Ever. (beat) How Rita do it wiffout a thought?
Rita and Jermaine study a sphinx.
Guide lady smart. Say dis the first civilization of the Earf. Black folks, first!
Jo Ann poses like an Egyptian hieroglyphic. Consuelo exam her nail polish.
Ms. Rain writes briskly across the blackboard. As she makes her way across the frame, a barrage of lette and numbers peel off the board, fly across the room, conv and enter Precious' forehead.
Just before the letters and numbers reach Precious, lifel holographic images flank them. They are SPINNING PLANETS,

head_text.subj: FLYING PTERODACTYLS, STAMPEDING ELEPHANTS, EMMETT TILL, M
JFK, MALCOLM X, CIVIL RIGHTS MARCHERS, FIRE, TIDAL WAVES,
VOLCANIC ERUPTION, CONTINENTS, MATHEMATICAL EQUATIONS, LI
BULBS AND THE INVERTED WORDS "JANIE", "SULA" AND "CELIE"

text: A few letters, numbers and images try to reach Jo Ann but most just bounce off of her and fall away. Consuelo bats few mathematical symbols off as if they were flies. Finally we land on Precious as she confidently stabs her into the air to answer a question.

Precious rides on one of the side seats towards the back while wearing her red scarf. The New Yorkers surrounding her are all men of various backgrounds. All wear the exact same suits and raincoats. Precious looks up to find two of the businessmen staring at her. We pan from them and around the bus to find all of the ot passengers studying Precious in silence as well.

I liked'd that museum so much I went back by myself... Peoples ...They only look when my belly big. They minds all made. But do they know? No. They do not know that I am a girl for flowers and thin straw legs?

If other peoples could see that the way I do, they would see that I am a real person inside. Our long circular pan finally lands on Precious' seat but sitting there now is the pretty blond white girl from Precious' bedroom mirror wearing Precious' clothes. The bus grinds to a stop. A man smiles at Precious and steps off the bus. The original Precious takes the abandoned newspaper from empty seat and tries to read it.
Precious stops to watch two "society" ladies in hats and gloves push antique buggy style baby carriages along the sidewalk.

Miz Rain say the longest journey begin wif a single step. I wonder what step they journeys begin on. Mama always talk about how there be all different types of welfare. I want filfy rich white folks welfare. Mama crazy but Mama not stupid. Precious continues observing pensively as the ladies pass bearded and bedraggled elderly white man laying on the st in tattered clothes. As Precious studies him, her expression changes ever so slightly. Enormous handwritten letters forming "NOT STUPID" overtak her face as we DISSOLVE TO the PAGE upon which she wrote
Precious writes in her notebook. All of the other girls d the same.

I am happy to be writing. I am happy to be in school. I am happy to know my baby coming soon. Don't see the sense in pretending I am not pregnant anymore. I am also thinking about lil Mongo a lot. Miz Rain say we gonna write everyday, that mean home too.
And she gonna write back everyday. Thas great. Precious looks up to find Jo Ann tapping her pencil, look around annoyed and literally at a loss for words.
Mama say this new school ain' shit tho. Say you can't learn nuffin' writing in no book. Gotta git on that computer you want to make some money. But Mama wrong about that.
I is learning. Gonna read to dis baby too and hang colors on its walls.
We close in on Precious writing as we hear her whisper th following.
Listen Baby, Muver love you. Muver not dumb. Listen:
(in a whisper)                 Thas the alphabet. Twenty- ABCDEFGHIJKLPMN                   letters in all. Them le O P Q R S T U V W X Y Z.          make up words. Them wor everything.

Precious looks up from her page gazing in an otherworldly One by one, the other girls stop what they're doing and s at Precious curiously. Their eyes turn downward in unison. CLOSE ON Precious' legs. A gush of water pours down between them as if it were a t wave.

...The wheels of a speeding gurney waggle to remain strai ...Fluorescent lights stream by overhead. ...Name tags dangle from the chests of attendants pushing gurney. One we see belongs to a handsome African American Male nu JOHN MCFADDEN. He is constantly looking down with a reassuring smile. ...Covered in sweat, Precious screams without our hearing sound.
...Two rain drops dance atop a puddle outside . ...Water drips from a tree limb .
His name Abdul Jamal Louis Jones. He healthy. His muver love him. John, the nurse who helped gurney Precious in, again star down warmly at her. This time with Abdul in her arms.
Precious sleeps peacefully. It is still raining outside. Rain crochets in the corner.

We are close on Precious. Her eyes focus intently and occasionally dart up and down. Nurse John is doing the same thing. His hands lay on top of Precious' with their palms touchi We glimpse both of their searching eyes again. Suddenly, Precious whips her hands over and SLAPS the bac John's before he can pull them away.
I win.
That hurt girl.
Get to X-Ray.
(leaving)
Maybe I will.
You gon have to if you don't practice.
Alright.
John exits. The girls from class ogle him from another part of the ro as he leaves and then nudge and bicker with each other fo pole position to hold Abdul.
Dear Miz Rain, All the years I sit in class I never learn, but now I got baby again by my fahver. Behind the girls, Precious sits up in bed writing in her journal.

I wish I had a boyfriend like other girls and then I'd feel right that I have to quit school. I love my baby but want school too. Precious closes her book. Jo Ann backs away from the othe takes the notebook and then leaves. Rhonda returns Abdul to Precious. The remaining girls emb Precious one at a time and then file out of the room.
As the girls stream into the classroom, Jo Ann sets Preci notebook on Ms. Rain's desk. Ms. Rain opens it immediately.
Ms. Rain writes at her desk.
Dear Precious, I am glad you love your baby.
I think a beautiful young girl like you should have a chance to get an education. I think your first responsibility has to be to yourself. You should not drop out of school ...
Precious reads from her journal.
Come back to class. We miss you. Love, Ms Rain.
Precious immediately writes back.
Dear Miz Rain...
Ms. Rain sits on the corner of bed reading Precious' jour

Social worker ask me if I want to give Little Mongo and Abdul up for adoption. I could kill her. She never help before. Now she want to take my kids away? If she take Abdul, I won't have nothing nomore.
Jo Ann bounds into the room with the journal in her hand, swipes an apple from Precious' tray and takes a bite. Precious snatches the journal and opens it quickly.

Dear Precious, It seems the opposite to me. If you keep Abdul you might have nothing. You are learning to read and write, that is everything. Come back to school when you get out of the hospital. You're only seventeen. Your whole life is in front of you.
TOOSIE paces Precious' hospital room briskly while holdin Abdul and lecturing Precious fiercely.
Dear Miz Rain, Grandmuver come visit and say only a dog will drop a baby and walk off. Say later not even a dog.
Precious' grandmother continues her sermon. Precious sigh

Dear Precious, You are not a dog. You are a wonderful young woman who is trying to make something of her life. I have some questions for you. 1. Where was your grandmother when your father was abusing you? 2. Where is Little Mongo now? 3. What is going to be the best thing for you in this situation?
Ms. Rain sits at her desk reading with her pen ready.

Dear Miz Rain, Lot of questions you ask. No muver, no grandmuver and father rape me years. Little Mongo wif my grandmuver. Best for me to stop breaving sometimes I think. I want to be a good mother too tho.
Ms. Rain writes immediately.
Dear Dear Precious, Being a good mother might mean letting your baby be raised by someone who is better able than you to meet the child's needs.
Precious writes while breast-feeding Abdul.
Dear Miz Rain, I is best able to meet my child's need.
The page turns.
The page falls. The students are all at their desks readi Ms. Rain writes the following.
Dear Precious, When you are raising a small infant you need help. Who is going to help you? How will you support yourself? How will you keep learning to read and write?

We drift towards Mary, at one with the couch, watching television. One hand holds a cigarette while the other mi an enormous bag of potato chips elbow-deep. Her greasy mouth remains occupied with either a cigarette potato chip or both at all times.
The welfare help Mama, it help me.
Dear Precious Miss, When you get home from the hospital, look and see how much welfare has helped your mother.

Nurse John and Precious sit quietly. Nurse John hands her envelope. Precious opens the envelope to find a beautiful card. It reads, "God Bless you." There is a $20 bill insi She looks up at him, teary eyed and grateful.
Precious, now wearing her jacket, packs up her things, ta Abdul and heads out of a spotless room with her child in hand and two bags in the other.
Precious rides holding Abdul.
You could go further than your mother. You could get your G.E.D. and go to college. You could do anything Precious but you have to believe it. Love, Blu Rain.
Precious heads into the main entrance holding Abdul and h bags as snowflakes start to fall.
Ruby plays alone with her broken Barbie doll. Precious pa her without a word. Ruby springs to her feet to trail her
Hi Precious. You back? That your new baby? What it's name? Can I hold it? ..Precious?
Ruby can only watch as Precious disappears into the stairwell.
Signs on the elevators read "OUT OF ORDER".

Precious climbs the stairs growing short of breath holdin Abdul, her bags and her coat folded over one arm. Once on the landing, she searches for her keys while tryi to balance Abdul and everything else. After turning several locks, she pushes into the apartmen
...looks up and ducks.
Bitch!!! CRASH!!! A flying vase barely misses Precious and Abdul a then shatters against the wall. Abdul WAILS.
SMASH! A plant comes next. Precious barely dodges that one too and she drops everyth but Abdul.

head_text.subj: YOU RUIN MY LIFE YOU FAT LITTLE

text: Mary charges into frame to ram Precious and Abdul like a bull. Precious sidesteps the charge as Mary leaves a huge indentation in the wall knocking over a side table and a potted plant in the process. She grabs her shoulder in pa Precious backs away around the living room to flee. Mary hurls what's left of the plant at Precious from down the floor.
Precious turns her back to shield Abdul. The pot strikes in the back. ABDUL SCREAMS louder. Dirt covers Precious.
As Mary gets to her feet ...
