YOU GET ME CUT OFF THE WELFARE YOU
I AIN'T STEAL NUFFIN FROM YOU MAMA
YOUR HUSBAND RAPE ME AND I NOT
ALWAYS GON BE NUTHIN BUT STUPID TIL

text: Tears well in Precious' eyes.
Mary GROWLS and charges Precious again. Precious turns the TV over between them. Electrical spark fly as it hits the floor. There is a banging at the door.

Mary, leave that chile alone. Stop beating that girl Mary. Mary trips and crashes down on top of the overturned television. Precious dashes out of the apartment with only Abdul as M struggles to get up.

head_text.subj: I DON'T KNOW HOW YOU DIDN'T

location: 444 LENOX AVE. HALL OUTSIDE PRECIOUS APT

text: Precious dashes out of the apartment with tears in her ey dirt on her clothes, no coat and Abdul SCREAMING IN HER A A little OLD WOMAN stands in the hallway shaking her head disgust.

Precious looks back, trips on the landing and tumbles dow flight of steps cradling and shielding Abdul all the way. THUD! A hard floor abruptly halts Precious' descent. She checks Abdul immediately. He is smiling. A DOOR OPENS followed by GRUNTS and a CRASH. Precious loo up to find the broken television tumbling down the steps towards them. At the last second, Precious manages to roll them both ou the way as the television crashes to the landing shatteri some more.
Precious bursts out of the stairwell with blood streaming down her nose and Abdul in her arms. Ruby dashes to inter them.
Precious what happened? Ruby places herself between Precious and the door while moving. Precious however, is in a big hurry.
Precious, could I see your baby now? I just wanna see. Precious shows no sign of slowing down. Ruby looks concer
Precious, what's wro... Precious knocks Ruby out of her way and to the floor with losing stride. Ruby lands hard and CRIES loudly.

Abdul still in her arms, Precious heads away from the building under dressed. The falling snow has thickened considerably. As she makes her way into the distance, Precious walks in the snowstorm carrying Abdul.
She hears the sound of a choir. She approaches the Church Basement where the voices are coming from. Precious stares through the window where Choir members ar praising The Lord.

Mary barrels into Precious' bedroom yelling and screaming she turns the place upside down. She rips down Precious' handprints along with her Cyndi Lauper poster. She then picks up a brush and hurls it int Precious' mirror, shattering it to pieces.
Precious, with Abdul in her arms, is singing along with t Choir, happier than ever. Tom Cruise joins in clapping, t stray dog that licked Precious in the beginning at his si
Precious sits on the steps of a hospital. Snow still fall She looks confused.
Precious steps out of an elevator wet from the snow and s splattered with dirt. She approaches a desk with urgency.
I need to see Nurse John. Where Nurse John at?

He's on break. He'll be back soon. Have a seat. Precious sits on one of a row of chairs by the wall. She tries to settle Abdul as he starts to CRY. The skinny Nurse's legs approach and stop in front of Precious.
Hey...You don't remember me do you?
Precious looks up to find A SOUR-LOOKING WOMAN glaring do at her.
I delivered your last one. Precious pauses as if searching for a response to satisfy this woman. Precious looks away. The nurse doesn't leave.
You know I'm sorry to see you back here. (beat)
I remembered hoping that you would have learned from your mistakes.
You don't know me bitch. Get lost 'fore I kick your ass. The nurse finally starts away.
Bitch? The nurse turns around.

I ain't make no mistake unless it was being born. DING! The elevator doors open. John steps off between Precious and the nurse. Precious starts to rise and John motions for her to stay seated. He sits beside her.
What happened?
My Mama kick my ass again. I ain' giving Abdul away. And I ain' gonna stop school ...I just...ain't. John looks concerned. Precious speaks with great resolve as if forcing herself believe her words.
I'm gonna get Little Mongo back too. (sighs)
I don't hardly even know what she look like now. Don't matter tho. That don't matter. John looks on heavy-hearted.

Precious   is dressed in a hospital gown and draped in a blanket.   It is still snowing. John holds an umbrella ov Precious   and a bag in one hand as he escorts her out on driveway   and into a large gray van. John places the bag in the van, hugs Precious, closes the door and then waves as the van pulls away. Precious turns to watch him recede into the snow through back window.
Nurse John say lots of people get out of hospital wif no place to go. His eyes look worried tho ...Wonder what next? Scared now.
Precious rides in darkness cradling Abdul. She looks up frightened, taking in the others sitting around her. Shes hold Abdul closer. The dark swallows her whole.

Bare light bulbs hang from the ceiling. Precious lays on a bed breast feeding Abdul and staring u the ceiling while covered in a blanket. We sail away to find they are surrounded by scores of rudimentary beds, many of which are filled with other wom of varying ages.
A BUG LADY lies next to her with unkempt hair and sores o her skin.
(murmuring)

...Put your bags in bed with you. Put your bags in the bed with you. Put 'em in. Tuck 'em in bed with you... The skinny woman on the other side sits up and grabs hers feverishly as if there were bugs allover her. AN ENORMOUS AND FEROCIOUS-LOOKING WOMAN IN HER FORTIES st up, snatches the blanket off of Precious and Abdul and wa off.
Give the chile back her blanket!

Fuck you. I ain' giving back shit. The woman walks away. Physically and emotionally spent, Precious sighs and then lifts her bed's top sheet, beneath which is a plastic-cov mattress. She then wraps the sheet around Abdul and herself and hun down. Precious rocks Abdul gently as her eyes wander around the cavernous armory.
(humming)

head_text.subj: AB C D E F G H I J K L M N 0 P, Q
RS T U V, W X Y Z.

text: (singing softly)
Now   I know my ABC's, tell me what you   think of me. Precious kisses Abdul on the head.
Miz Rain say I was moving through the vowel 'n consonant sounds faster than even Rhonda Johnson was. Maybe could've even catched up to Jermaine. Maybe ...
Precious sleeps soundly. Something nudges her slightly. When she finally opens her eyes ... Abdul is gone! So is her bag. Precious springs up in a panic turning in every direction

Where my baby?! Where my baby at?! The Bug Lady casually points to the exit. The large ferocious woman heads for the exit with Abdul i one arm and Precious' bag in the other. She looks down at Abdul making "baby" faces and sounds. Precious dashes after her but winces in pain grabbing her pelvic area along the way. The Bug Lady follows Precious as a speed walker might. Precious snatches Abdul and promptly knees the ferocious woman hard in the gut. The ferocious woman MOANS as she falls to the ground. Precious continues kicking and stomping her without aband The bug girl observes stoically. Abdul WAILS. As she trounces the woman, Precious' eyes fill with a rag haven't yet seen. Finally, two other women pull Precious away while she sti kicks at the woman. The ferocious woman, now bloodied, falls over on her back with her eyes closed and her mouth hanging open.
A bright morning skyline stretches over the Hotel Theresa
Ms. Rain, at work a little earlier than usual this mornin looks great, and ready for another day.
Ms. Rain enters the lobby. The window of the entry door h been smashed. She opens the door with a look of trepidati

Ms. Rain steps into her classroom carrying two bags. She removes her sunglasses. The sight before her stops her in her tracks. She drops h bags immediately. It is Precious, sleeping on the floor with Abdul in her a Her hand is cut and bleeding pretty bad. Ms. Rain looks incensed.
Precious sits rocking Abdul with a bandaged hand. Ms. Rain, still fuming, sits on the other side of the off dialing a phone number from a list on the wall.
I can tell by Miz Rain's face that I ain' gonna be homeless no more. Only I ain' so sure where I'm gon end up tho.
(sternly)
Yes I'll hold. (grumbling while on hold)
Safety net huh? What damn safety net?! A newborn child! A NEW BORN! In this fucking day and...
Thas the one time I heard Miz Rain curse.
Excuse my language Precious. Precious nods.
I feels really sorry for her. She just a ABC teacher, not no social worker. But she all I could think of.
Rhonda, Jermaine and Consuelo appear in the doorway.
Hi Precious!
What happened?
They start for Abdul immediately. Ms. Rain stops them just as quickly.

Good morning girls. Tell the others to start writing when they come in. Whichever one of you is older is in charge until I get back. And Consuelo, I know that is not you. So here is $20.00. Ms. Rain digs into her purse to find the money. She hands to Consuelo.
Go get something for Precious to wear. Quick! And bring me back my change. The girls nod and leave.

location: DOORWAY BETWEEN MS. RAINS OFFICE AND CLASSROOM

text: Rhonda and Jermaine head off down the hall.
How old you is?
Same age as you.
When your birthday?
When yours?
I asked you first.
So ...
Ms. Rain still waits on hold until ...
Well why didn't you tell me that before!!! I'm sitting here half the-
Ms. Rain slams the phone down, shakes her head, finds ano number on the wall and then dials again while speaking to Precious.
Before this day is up, you will have a place to live Precious. Ms. Rain suspends her frustration with a brief smile as s waits for the other end of the line to pick up.
Jo Ann saunters in. The other girls are writing already. Rhonda is at the head of the class displaying unusually g posture.
(looking at her watch)
Jo Ann, you late.
You ain't the teacher.
I am today. Miz Rain busy wif Precious.
(thrilled)
Alright!!! (concerned)
How Precious?
Ms. Rain hangs up the phone. She looks tired.
They have ...something. It's an immediate opening and it's in Queens. Precious looks concerned.
Queens?
Yeah. Queens ...What do you think?
(beat)
I don't really know Queens.
Me either. You should stay in Harlem...long as we can anyway.
Ms. Rain takes an organizer from her bag, looks for anoth number and picks up the phone.
I have this West Indian friend whose boyfriend is a council member. (with uncertainty)
We'll see what they can do...

Precious exits the girls bathroom carrying Abdul. She spo a new sweat suit. She pauses before entering Each One Teach One Reception A and observes Ms. Rain speaking on the phone for a moment. Suzanne, the school's administrator stands by.
Hey Precious. Precious jumps and turns around to find Cornrows passing
Hi Miss Lisa.
(still moving)
How you been?
Good. How you been?
I don't know... I went to see that movie Barfly last night... That piece of shit was depressin...Cute kid.
Thanks. Ms. Rain still on the phone.
I have the information on my desk. Can you hold one second? Ms rain places the call on hold.
(to   Suzanne) I think   I may be onto something. (to   Precious) Come on   Precious.
Precious and Ms. Rain walk back to her classroom.
Ms. Rain and Precious enter the classroom as the girls wr studiously. Rhonda supervises in a staid manner. Clearly is enjoying her new appointment.
How do you spell "Aquarius"?
What you want to spell that for?
A-Q-U-A-R-I-U-S.
Is that right?
Of course it's right. I'm one of `em.
I wonder can you spell "boy" then.
I wonder can you spell "slut" then.
Maybe, but I bet Miss Lisa can.
Ms. Rain picks up the line holding.
Yes Brenda. Thank you.
Ms. Rain hangs up the phone, turns to Precious and exhale
They can take you. Tomorrow...at a place here in Harlem.
Precious looks relieved.
You just need somewhere to stay tonight. (beat) You don't snore do you?
Precious smiles.

Precious sits at a small kitchen table in a modest but co and craftily-decorated apartment. Fresh flowers adorne he table. She breast feeds Abdul and drinks from a tall glass of gr juice. Ms. Rain clears the table of plates and take-out containers.

head_text.subj: WHITNEY HOUSTON IS PLAYING LOUD. KATHERINE, A SEXY BLACK

text: WOMAN who it seems has just awoken, descends the stairs. She's not in a good mood.
Honey, how many times did I tell you about the music? She stops in mid sentence when she sees precious. Her moo changes.
(warmly)
You must be Precious. Hi. Katherine bends down to admire Abdul.
Precious, this is my wife Katherine. Precious looks confused. She spits her drink out. A lot o which lands on Abdul. She wipes Abdul.
Huh?
I said that this is my wife Katherine. Precious' mouth is agape.
(smiling at Abdul) What's his name? He's adorable.
This Abdul.
He looks just like you.
Thanks. (beat) Y'all really married?
Yes Precious. Very much.
Precious still looks confused.
The ladies lounge around the living room. Ms. Rain and Katherine hold glasses of wine. Precious still looks as i she's trying to keep up.
...Ask yourself. Just ask yourself; if Ronald McDonald were running the show and the price of hamburgers skyrocketed, wouldn't you be suspicious?
I just think you should finish the book.
Who's gonna read it?
Nobody if you don't write it. Precious writes everyday. You should try it.
What do you write about Precious?
I don't know. Stuff in my life. Abdul.
(beat) How come y'all don't like McDonalds?
Katherine was just drawing a comparison so that her point could be more easily understood...

Together, these homo ladies        It's called an analogy talk like TV channels I don't      example, my uncle Clay watch. I'm glad Abdul here to      used to smoke like a c listen in on 'em tho cause I       and drink like a fish know they smart.                   he got saved. An Etta James tune begins ...

Ms. Rain and Katherine, high from the wine, spin each oth lazily in a playful dance. Precious sits watching carefully. She lifts and smells th gardenias from the table. Precious starts to pour a bottle of wine into her glass.
Mama say homos is bad peoples ...
A hand intercepts the bottle. It is Ms. Rain's. She then pours it into her own glass and takes the bottle with her she returns to Katherine.
...But homos not who rape me, homos not who let me sit up in school 16 years and learn nuffin and homos not sell crack to peoples in Harlem. I wonder what Oprah have to say about that?
Ms. Rain looks over to Precious.
You okay Precious?
Precious nods.
Y' all watch Oprah?
Ms. Rain gives her a loving smile.
Miz Rain the one who put the chalk in my hand, make me queen of ABC's.
Precious smiles back with gratitude and great affection.
Ms. Rain and Katherine continue dancing in the window as Precious observes. The evening cityscape sparkles around them.

Streamers hang from the walls. Various handwritten versio of "Congratulations Precious", obviously written by the girls, stretch across the blackboard in uneven-sized lett Precious stands beside Ms. Rain holding a small trophy an check. The other girls flank them standing very straight. wear big grins.

Nurse John, without his uniform, has just taken a picture everyone. The girls go straight for the cookies and punch waiting a an orange tablecloth on Ms. Rain's desk. They begin a Sou Train Line and dance around the desk as Nurse John approa Ms. Rain to converse.

After I settle in halfway house, I work my hardest to memorize letter sounds, write in journal and read smaller and fatter books. Then I find out Mayor's office give me Literacy Award and check for progress. Everybody at the party, Nurse John, Cornrows and the staff stop in too, but they need to get back to they desks before too long. Whole operation can't stop just cause Miss Precious get a trophy. Even Ms. Katherine shows. John discreetly beckons Precious over to the side as she blows into a noisemaker. Both she and John dance in high spirits.
John hands Precious a giftwrapped present. She shakes it then opens it. It is a leather bound journal with blank pages. Precious flips through it.
Thanks Nurse John. They exchange a familiar, moderately complicated handshak
You're welcome. What are you gonna do with your award money?
I owe the chicken place for a bucket that I swiped last year. Thas first. After that, get some thangs for Abdul.
You know Blu?
Miz Rain?
Yeah. Precious holds up two intertwined fingers.
Like dis.
Well she has, has she uh...got a man?
Well I was hoping you could put in the good word.
The good word...wif Ms. Rain?
Yeah, that's what I'm trying to say.
You ain't her type. John looks confused.

Precious leads John down the hall by the hand. She stops in front of Cornrows' desk as Cornrows converse the phone while picking her nails. The previously illegible sign on her desk now reads "EACH TEACH ONE".
(on the phone noticing Precious)
Hold on girl. Cornrows lowers the phone and waits for Precious to speak
Miss Lisa this Nurse John. Nurse John this Miss Lisa. Cornrows looks up at John. Precious heads back to the party. Nurse John and Cornrows watch her curiously.
Y'all work it out. Nurse John and Cornrows turn to each other.
Hi ...How are you? Cornrows looks him up and down then hangs up the phone without looking.
I get off at 4.

The room is empty except for Ms. Rain standing on a chair taking streamers down. Precious appears in the doorway and studies Ms. Rain a mo as if seeing her for the first time. Ms. Rain steps down from her chair looking tired. Precious enters the room.
Miz Rain?
Precious, I thought you went home.
Not yet. I forgot to say thank you for my party.
You're welcome. It was my pleasure.
Precious just watches her.
Was there something else?
(beat) Are you sure?
Well, I was thinking...
Yes?
You talk to us girls in the class when we be working out problems and thangs and stuff, right?
Ms. Rain speaks to Precious while picking up around the r
Mm hm...
Well, who do you talk to?
Caught off guard, Ms. Rain looks at Precious curiously.
(quickly) Or you probably don't have no problems so...
Everybody has those Precious.
Ms. Rain, some folks just got it made in the shade.
It only looks that way. Yes, I talk to people all the time for support.

Oh, okay...I didn't have nobody to really speak wif for a long time. I know how that be sometimes so thas why I asked cause almost evrybody need a little help once in a ... Ms. Rain abruptly stops what she's doing. Precious looks alarmed.
What on earth are you talking about?
(confused)
Well ...only that -well, evrybody need a little help once in a ...
What?!
(scared)
I jus ...
You just what?!
(terrified)
I just thought that if you might need some ...
Precious?!
(trembling)
...Yes.
You've helped me already.
Precious looks both confused and relieved. Ms. Rain sits while motioning for Precious to do the same.
(sitting) Me? I never...
Precious stops as Ms. Rain looks away as if gathering her thoughts. Finally...

Last night I had a conversation with my mother, and that never happens cause our relationship is.... complicated. We don't speak, and when we do, it always ends in a fight about my filthy misguided existence. Most times I feel terrible for days afterwards wondering whether all the hateful things she said are true. Those days I just feel like...like...
Nuffin?

...Yeah. I didn't feel so bad this time though. (beat) Cause this time I thought about how strong you've had to be and then I decided that I had nothing to be ashamed of and that my mother was wrong about me, my dad and 5 or 6 hundred other things. You ask if you can help me? Baby, you already have.
...For real?
That's the for real, hope to die if I'm lying truth. Now shouldn't you be out the door?
I jus help you finish up first. I got some time.
(standing)
Suit yourself. Ms. Rain motions to the other end of a long folding table Precious takes hold of it and they carry it across the ro together. As we watch from a distance...

Some folks got a light around them that shine for other peoples. I think maybe some of them was in a long tunnel before. And in that tunnel, maybe the only light they had was one that was inside of them and then -even long after they escaped that tunnel, they still be shining for everybody else. Thas Miz Rain to me.

Precious' trophy sits on the windowsill beneath a thin a layer of dust. A stack of books sit on her bureau. Colorful letters and numbers hang on the wall. Beneath th hang postcards featuring Zora Neal Hurston, Alice Walker, Maya Angelou and Oprah Winfrey. Abdul sleeps in his crib. Precious makes her bed.

In a book I read, a lady escaped to a 1/2 way house. And the lady, she asked the people there just what a 1/2 way house was. They tole her, you is 1/2 way between the life you had and the life you want to have ...Thas nice. That also mean I can't stay here forever and that there is still a ways to go. It be something to get apartment of my own.
A larger Abdul steps towards us with Precious behind him wearing a cotton dress that looks vaguely like one Ms. Ra might wear.
Abdul nine months old and walking! Smart too. I been reading to him since the day he was born almost. Barely talkin' and he countin' .
Precious plays with Abdul in the shallow end of the commu swimming pool.
Mama, Daddy, I.S. III and 444 Lenox Avenue already seem like a past life or some old bad dream. I wish I could have started out from here but still wif Abdul and poor Mongo.
Precious looks out of her open window with a glass of wat in her hand. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK.
Come in... Precious closes her window. The door to her room opens. CHELSEA, A 30-S0METHING SOCIA WORKER steps in looking slightly uncomfortable.
Precious ...you have a visitor.
Thas Rhonda. She always early. Precious rises.
I should've said 4 'cause then that way...
It's not Rhonda.
Precious stops.

Precious descends a staircase to a long corridor clearly in thought every step of the way. She stops momentarily to straighten her clothes. When she finally reaches a day room at the other end of t hall, she looks through its window for a moment. Mary sits inside crushing and dwarfing the couch upon whi she waits. She looks frail. Her wig is half combed. She's nervous. Her sweaty hands crumple her cigarette package. Precious covers her nose a moment, lowers her hand, readi herself and then steps into the room.

Once inside the room, and for the first time, Precious' s face looks like stone. Mary looks up with a brief but quickly fading smile that pathetic, apologetic and grim. Precious waits. The air is thick without a single word between them. Finally, Mary looks down.
Your daddy dead.
Precious looks surprised for a moment but still composed. Mary waits for a response.
...Is that all?
No. (beat) Carl ...Carl had that AIDS virus.

A previously unseen woman sitting across the room looks u from behind a newspaper. Precious stays stone-faced until she finally GASPS as the aftershock of the revelation hits her squarely. The man across the room collects his hat and coat and lea

head_text.subj: TOP OF PRECIOUS, PRECIOUS FOLLOWING ABDUL TAKING EARLY ST

text: We return to the dayroom as Precious opens her eyes and l them to Mary slowly.
... You got it?
Got what?
The AIDS virus.
No.
How you know?
We never did, you know...
No, I don't know Mama.
We never did what you got to do to get it.
He never been wif you?
Yeah...but not like faggots, in the ass and all, so I know.
Precious is speechless. It looks as if some of her anger suddenly been displaced with pity.
Precious sighs.
You better go to the doctor Ma. Mary looks up delicately.
You welcome back home.
I'm home here. (beat)
I better go see 'bout Abdul and do homework. Mary doesn't move as Precious leaves. Mary sits staring at the floor at the far side of the roo

Precious enters, takes Abdul from his crib, holds him clo and sits on her bed. Moments later, a TAPPING on the window draws her attentio Precious rises to find Tom Cruise hurling pebbles up at h window in a leather jacket. A MOTORCYCLE sits a few feet away from him. He beckons her. She stares down at him with solemn eyes. Tom finally mounts his bike and vanishes into thin air wh revving its engine. Mary then crosses the frame where he was. Precious turns to Abdul and kisses him on the head.
Precious walks over the crest of a hill deep in thought w her hands in her pockets. The constant HUM of the city se lower than usual as Precious' FOOTSTEPS make the most prominent sound.
From this distant view, it appears as if she is almost walking in place.

Ms. Rain stands before the blackboard with a piece of cha in her hand pointing to the word "unrelenting", which is written behind her. Consuelo is missing and TWO NEW GIRLS, AISHA, INDIAN AND GUYANA AND BUNNY, VERY THIN WITH BAD TEETH have joined th class.
Rita, what do I mean when the author describes her protagonist's circumstances as "unrelenting"?
I don't know Miz Rain.
C'mon Rita, think about the question before you just give up like that... Ms. Rain's voice trails off as we find Precious lost in thought.
Precious waits in a small gray office. A FEMALE COUNSELOR WITH SYMPATHETIC EYES carrying a file across from her. Her eyes say everything. The counselor places a hand on top of Precious'.
All the girls write in their journals except for Precious who again looks preoccupied. Ms. Rain watches her.
Precious? Precious doesn't respond.
Precious?
The entire class looks up at Precious. Ms. Rain waits for a response.
Precious, bring your journal to me.

Precious waits a moment and then shakes her head without looking up. Ms. Rain goes to her desk and picks up the journal withou resistance. The words "Why me?" sit alone on the page with lines cros through them. Ms. Rain returns the journal to Precious' d still opened to the same page.
Precious, would you come to my office for a moment?
Precious doesn't respond. The class still watches curiously. Ms. Rain, steps back, sits on the edge of her desk and fo her arms.
Preci-
Nurse say I am H.I.V. positive.
The air changes sharply. Everything stops. Precious exhales.
I don't have nuffin to write today and I don't hate no one. Not even my muhver. My head is all dark inside so I don't have nuffin to write today...Maybe nuffin never.
Rita rises, walks to Precious and embraces her. Tears wel Precious' eyes.
Still trying to stay composed, Precious wipes her face. Ms. Rain rises, walks to Precious and rubs her back as sh looks around to the other girls who are still stunned.
Your baby okay? The class waits on pins and needles. Precious doesn't ans at first and just looks down until ...
Yeah. He good...Won't bress feed him no more to be safe.
(to Precious)
One time in your journal you told me that you had never really told your story. (softly)
write. Precious' eyes well up some more. She wipes her face again.
What for? How?! I feel like I am drowning inside a giant river Miz Rain. Thas what... Precious stops herself abruptly as if being overwhelmed b sense of futility.
I think telling your story will get you over that river Precious ... Precious erupts hurling her journal sharply across the ro It bounces hard off the blackboard and stops abruptly on floor facedown.

head_text.subj: MARRY ME BUT HOW HE DO THAT,

text: The class looks shocked. Precious' wet eyes are filled wi fury.
A moment later, Ms. Rain walks calmly across the room, retrieves the journal and places it back on top of Precio desk.
Open your notebook Precious.
(exasperated)
I'm tired Miz Rain!

I know you are but you can't stop now. You gotta fight through this. You still have to live your life and do the best you can with the hand you've been dealt. If not for yourself then for the people who love you. Precious HUFFS cynically.
Nobody love me. Thas a lie.
People do love you Precious.
Please don't lie Miz Rain! Love?! Me?! Love rape me, beat me, call me animal, get me sick and make me feel wurfless. I had enough love.
That wasn't love. There are people in this room who love you. Your child loves you too. Is that clear Precious? Now if Rita decided to just give up? Would you let her? Precious doesn't answer.
Would you?!
(reluctantly)
No.
And why not?!
Precious doesn't answer.
Because you love her...as much as she loves you. Precious looks to her side and finds Rita smiling reassuringly through her crooked teeth.

Now the rest of the world can judge you, cheat you, beat you, dismiss you and abandon you all it wants but we won't let you give up and that's the only thing that matters. Some people have less than that on their side and still manage to keep going. (beat)

It's up to you. Precious thinks a long moment, wipes her face and exhales She doesn't move for what seems like ages. The whole class watches her until Ms. Rain motions for th to continue working. Finally, Precious takes hold of her opens her journal, sighs deeply and starts to write again
Our young ladies and Ms. Rain are seated around a picnic table eating, laughing, talking and writing in their jour all at the same time. Precious has found friends. As we watch Rhonda ...
Some things is hard to say and maybe not your business no way but Rhonda's brother rape her for years and when her muhver fine out, she throw Rhonda out her house. As we watch Rita smiling...
Rita's daddy kill her muhver in front of her eyes and Rita been out on the street selling herself since she 12.
As we watch Jermaine laughing...
Jermaine say mens beat her and then rape her for what she is. Muhver throw her out the house when she fine out that she different from other girls.
As we watch Ms. Rain.
Miz Rain still a sort of mystery, but a nice one like the sun.
As we watch the group from a distance...

Miz Rain right too. These girls is my family now. They visit me at hospital when I had Abdul and even take up a collection when Mama kick me out. They got love in they eyes and in they hearts for me, same as I got for them.
Ms. Weiss speaks from behind her desk as Precious sits on couch beside her backpack looking bored.
...You know you can use your notebook between sessions Claireece.
I do.
I mean you can use it specifically for trying to recover certain early memories.
Precious nods mechanically.

Tired of this lady asking me questions. Miz Rain say talk anyway but Miz Weiss just a spy for the State who write reports on me undercover. Reports go in file. File say what I could get, where I could go and if I could get cut off and kicked out of Advancement House.
(beat) What are you thinking?
Nothing.
Oh I doubt that Claireece. It seems like you're always thinking about something.
I don't know. It's sort of hot in here I guess.
It is, isn't it? As a matter of fact, I'm going to get myself something to drink. Would you like something to drink Claireece?
A soda sounds nice ...please.
What kind?
I don't care.
Oh c'mon, you must.
Orange.
Okee Dokee.
Ms. Weiss collects some change, grins at Precious and the steps out of the room leaving her purse open on the desk.
Back in a jiffy. The moment the door closes, Precious dashes across the ro for the file cabinet behind Ms. Weiss' desk. Precious searches the drawers in the cabinet and rifles through the files.
Ms. Weiss inserts several pieces of change into a vending machine and presses a button. A can of Soda CLUNKS down through the bowels of the machine.
Pouring through the "J" files, Precious stops at Jones an then first goes for "P". She sees nothing, sucks her teet thinks a moment and then looks for "C".
Ms. Weiss saunters back towards the office whistling soft with 2 sodas in her hand.

Precious finally finds the file with her name on it and l up as FOOTSTEPS sound outside the door. Ms. Weiss steps in. Precious is now seated on the couch again with a corner o her file protruding from her bookbag. Ms. Weiss hands Precious her soda.
Thank you.
You know your mother's been calling here wanting to come visit.
Really?
Would you like her to come to a counseling session with you?
I don't know. I never really thought about it before.
Well that's just one more thing to consider before I see you next week.
Ms. Weiss smiles at Precious. Precious smiles back.
Jermaine rocks Abdul's crib with one hand while looking a the file with Precious as both girls sit cross-legged on Precious' bed. Precious reads carefully.

'I have just finished a session with Claireece Precious Jones, an eighteen-year-old African American female. According to her teachers at Each One Teach One where she attends school she is a pen-, phen-
... 'phenomenal'

...success. Having made strides so tre-men-tremendous in the past year, she was given the mayor's award for outstanding achievement. She seems actively en...engaged in all aspects of the learning process. However, her TABE test scores are disappointingly low... ' Not to Miz Rain! Not to Miz Rain! (continuing) 'She scored 2.8 On her last test.' So what! Miz Rain-

Get a grip and gon' read the report and don't get all emotional about what this silly hoe got to say. Anyway, if your shit wasn't dope you wouldn't be standing up here readin' -what, what's her name (looks up on the page)
Ms. Weiss. What Ms. Weiss got to say.
Precious continues.
'She will need at least an 8.0 Before she can enter G.E.D. Class and begin work toward her high school e-q...equivalency.'
Surprised and impressed, Jermaine double takes on Preciou
...Nice.
Thanks. (beat) 'Abdul is the client's second-born child. He's from all outwhere...
'outward'...
'Appearances, a healthy and welladjusted toddler. Precious attends to his needs a-s-s-i-d-u-o-s-l-y...
Precious and Jermaine look at each other. Both are at a loss...
Whatever.
... 'and with great affection and ee... '
'eagerly'
... 'seeks any and all information on child rearing. The time and resources it would require for this young woman to get a G.E.D. or into college would be considerable'...
Precious stops reading abruptly and hands the file to Jermaine. Jermaine looks at Precious oddly.
Finish reading this ...I know what's coming. Jermaine pauses and then continues reading the file as Precious rises and paces the room.

'Although she is in school now, it is not a job readiness program. Nonetheless, Claireece is capable of going to work. In January, her son will be two years old. In keeping with the new initiative on welfare reform, I feel Claireece would benefit from any of the various workfare programs in existence. Despite her obvious intellectual limitations she is quite capable of working as a home attendant.'
I don't want to be no motherfucking home attendant! I wanna be...

Hush! 'My rapp-o-r-t with Precious is minimal. Although I am not sure with whom, she evidently has access to counseling services provided by Each One Teach One. She has a history of sexual abuse and is H.I.V. positive.'
She say she not put that in my file! Bitch!
That's the bitch's job, to get the mofuckin' goods on you! (continuing)
'The client seems to view the social services, AFDC, as taking care of her forever.' Jermaine sets the file down and looks up at Precious.
(beat)
That file do show one thing -that
this hoe don't know nuffin wurf knowing about Claireece Precious Jones.
I'm getting my G.E.D., a job, and a place for me and Abdul, then I go to college. I don't want to 'home attend' nobody!
You better put this shit back before you get in trouble. We talk about it with Ms. Rain in the morning.
Precious hurries into a room carrying Abdul. The sign on door says "DAYCARE". Precious dashes out of the room alone.
And don't be coming back late for his bad ass neither.
Precious marches to school with her bookbag and red scarf She clearly has a lot on her mind.

Miz Weiss just part of the gang but definitely not cool. And social worker look at me like I am ugly freak who did something to make my own life like it is. I guess I am trying to figure out just what has happened to me while Miz Weiss just hell bent on making me go wipe old people's asses. Precious crosses the street.
Got to sort dis out quick tho 'fore Abdul's next birthday -coming up fast.
The whole class writes until Ms. Rain looks at her watch and...
Time is up. Does anyone want to share?
The only hand up belongs to Precious'.
Okay Precious.
I don't really want to read all I wrote, I jus' wanna kinda say what it is I'm writing about and how it came about.
What happened?
Well, to make a long story short, the counselor at Advancement House quizzing me about Mama and Daddy etc., etc. But it's really about workfare. She want to send me out as home attendant.
How you know?
Cause I stole my file from Advancement House and read it.
The class GASPS.
Next time get mine's too.

All this 'What you wanna be?' And 'You can talk to me.' They ain' no motherfucking therapists on our side, they just flunkies for the 'fare. I wanna work, but not for no motherfucking welfare check in Central Park -displacing brothers and sisters who really got jobs cleaning up 'cause I'm there working for free.
Jermaine speaks while slouched in her chair with her feet crossed and arms folded.

And what kinda shit is it for someone like Precious to have quit school before she get her G.E.D. to work at some live-in job for some old-ass crackers. She'll never make a rise she get stuck in some shit like that!
Sit up straight Jermaine and watch your language. Both of you. Please. Jermaine reluctantly sits up.
Now I see your points, but is stealing...
Miz Rain, If I didn't steal that file I wouldn't know what I was facing!
You read the whole thing by yourself?
Yeah...basically.
Rhonda home attend. Say old bitch would ring a bell when she want Rhonda in the night!
Rhonda used to have to go all the way out to Brighton Beach where she work for them people.
The people had her there all day and night - 'on call' they call it. But you only get pay for 8 hours so that's 8 X $6.37 (referring to her notebook)
= $50.96 a day, but then you is not really getting that much cause you is working more than eight hours a day. You is working 24 hours a day and 50.96 divided by 24 is...
(referring to her notebook)
$2.12 by my count.
Rhonda say old bitch would ring a bell - a actual bell -when she want Rhonda in the night!
Home attendants usually work six days a week. I would only see Abdul on Sundays? When would I go to school? (beat)
Am I gonna hafta go be home attendant like Rhonda was?

No! So stop worrying about it. We'll cross that bridge when we get to it. Trust me -no, trust yourself. My concern now is that if this Ms. Weiss is someone you're working with and can't trust, she's out! We gotta find somebody else.
(beat)

Well, I just write in my notebook till I get wif some kinda therapist I can trust. Actually that always help me more than talking to her. Plus, I'm going to start going to meetings wif Rita for insect survivors.
Incest.
That's what I mean.
Well it ain't what you been saying.
What's the big deal?
One's where your family molest you, the other is like a roach or bugs.
Precious, have you ever had your hearing tested?

No. I never really had nothing tested...nothing like that. Glasses is what I really want so my eyes don't hurt when I be reading at night. The sound of a RUMBLING BUS ENGINE accelerating leads us to...
Rita looks out the window of a moving 102 bus and then st across the aisle and sits beside Precious who stares out window pensively.

Rita and me on our way. I look at subway map sometimes and wonder where I be if I go to the end of the line. Jermaine say there be a white boy wif a baseball bat when you get off. Rita say it's not true, or if it be true, it's only part true. The bus comes to a stop and the girls dash out the back d
Precious and Rita climb up out of the subway.
Precious and Rita walk with Precious looking around as Ri hums quietly.
In a simple meeting room, women of all different ages, co and strata sit in a large circle.

head_text.subj: IRENE, A GORGEOUS SLENDER BLOND WITH LUSTROUS HAIR AND

text: SPARKLING EYES stands.
Hello and welcome to our Tuesday night beginner's meeting...My name is Irene. I am an incest survivor...
Precious looks utterly amazed. Her jaw drops. From here, women's voices are so faint that they are barely audible we hear Precious' thoughts.

This girl look like a movie       It started when I was a star and she in here too?!        or 5 years old with him All kinda women in here.          fondling me. By the tim Princess girls, big girls,        was 12, he was having old women, young women, white     intercourse with me 3 o women, lotta white women.         Times a week... A montage of other women standing and speaking follows. A the women talk, Precious' face fills with the wonder of seeing the world through the window of a spacecraft heade for re-entry. CANDACE, SIXTIES, WHITE speaks next.

What am I hearing?! What in       ....I didn't remember w h the world?! One hour and a        father did to me for so alf women talk. How can this     years until after he die happen to so many people? CAITLIN, 20's, WHITE speaks.

And these is just the ones        ...I am a proud lesbian that come out to the meeting.     it's the only thing I'm What about the rest? Do I         of. I was confined to a pass them in the street and       mental institution for do not know?                      years.... Finally, Precious stands. She looks around as if seeing from the top of a mountain. Finally she clears her throat and then ...
I was raped by my father and beat by my mother ever since I could remember anything at all. Raped and beat by both.

The worst part about it...the part even worse than them doin' it...was how shamed I felt during the times when my father was raping me and it felt ...good. Anyway, I see a girl and always think I know how easy or bad she have it just by lookin'. Now I wonder if everybody go through sumthin' -sumthin' that leave a shadow in they life. (exhales)
Never said alla that before... Precious looks around the room to find herself surrounded understanding eyes.
Anyway, thas all I'd like to say for today. Thank y'all for letting me share... Irene nods and Precious sits. Rita squeezes her hand. Ano woman stands up to recount her story. Precious looks aglo
Everything is floating around me now. Like geeses from the lake. I see flying. Feel flying. Am flying. Far up...Thank you Rita for getting me here on time.

The group slowly emerges. A table with a nice arrangement cookies stands next to a coffee maker and soda machine. Irene chats with Candace over a cup of coffee. Precious a Rita talk with TWO OTHER YOUNG WOMEN, MIRIAM, BLACK 20's PRETTY DREADLOCKS and LISA, WHITE 20's.
...How you get your hair like that?
Oh, you like it? I do yours one day if you want. That's what I do - fix people's hair and makeup. Miriam hands Precious a card. Precious reads the card carefully and puts it away with care.
Thank you Miriam.
(to Precious) Do you want another hot chocolate?
Precious smiles and shakes her head no. Rita gets up. Precious watches her go as Miriam and Lisa chat.
Rita ask me do I want another hot chocolate. I do but I don't want to be greedy, even if her boyfriend do give her money.
Precious looks around at all of the other girls.

I'm alive inside. A bird is my heart. Mama and Daddy didn't win. I'm winning. I'm drinking hot chocolate on the Upper West Side with girls - all kind who love me. How does a stranger meet me and love me?
Rita returns with two cups of hot chocolate.       She gi to Precious. Precious thanks Rita with her eyes.

Precious, wearing her new scarf and glasses, sits in the waiting room holding a book in her hands. Abdul plays amo the little children in the kids area behind her. Crumpled wrapping paper lays beside her. The book's first page rea CONGRATULATIONS PRECIOUS! I'M SO PROUD OF YOU YET AGAIN.
Sheila and Ruby walk in and sit down beside Precious. Rub has a black eye. They sit in silence for a few moments, waiting for their turn.
Sheila Hewitt, Ms. Rubenstein is                          ready for you.
(To Ruby)                                        Go on back there!
But there are no kids there I can                    play with.
Do you want me to knock your other                   eye out! Just sit there and shut                     up then! I'm going to talk to this                   lady before my shit gets cut off!
Sheila heads up the stairs toward the offices. Precious closes her book. Its cover reads: Chrystal Stair: Selecte Works by Langston Hughes.
Clareece Precious Jones!   Mrs.                      Weiss is ready for you.

Precious stands up and looks down at Ruby, sulking in her chair. She leans down, gives her a big hug and tenderly fixes Ruby's hair. Precious walks off toward the stairs, but stops when she passes a mirror hanging on the wall. Within the reflectio she sees her true self for the first time.
One day Miz Rain ask us to write about our ideal self...I wrote that I would be light skinned and small wif wavy swing-job hair. She heads up the stairs toward the offices.
(beat)

Miz Rain read all that and then say I am beautiful like I am. I never believe her before but somehow, today, this moment -can't say why, I do. Just now...The inside I thought was so beautiful is a black girl too.

Precious turns around to find that Ruby has grabbed her a She then reaches up and hugs Precious tightly. Through the embrace, Precious finds herself facing the ma mirrors on display by the old man on the folding chair. I her reflections, she sees the skinny white girl who she h frequently imagined herself as gradually transform into t real Precious one by one.
We tilt down upon a stately pre-war building bathed in st wintry light.
Perhaps we should begin by talking a little bit about the abuse.
Mary looks worse than ever. Her hair and clothing are disastrous. She rocks somewhat anxiously on the edge of h seat like a desperate salesman looking to close a deal.
'Buse?
Yes Ms. Johnston. Abuse.
There was no drugs in ma house! No drugs! 'Cause Precious know damn well I whoop her ass bright blue if she bring some drugs in ma...
I'm referring to inappropriate acts of a physical and sexual nature involving Precious.
Why'nt you say dat? Dat?! Okay. When it first start?
Yes. According to Precious' files she has had two children by your boyfriend, the late Carl Kenwood Jones, who is also her father?
You've been calling here saying you want to be reunited with your daughter and grandson and that you want them to come home. Well I think you'd better explain just what happened in that home.
Precious waits nervously.

...Well, I, Precious b'long at home cause I'm a good mother. She had everything. I done tole her that. Pink 'n white baby carriage, little pink bootie socks, dresses; everything I put on her pink. Precious, she so smiling and healthy. A day don't go by I don't throw her wheeling in the air. I take her up and down 125th Street. Me 'n Carl loved Precious. I dreamed of the day we was gonna you know, git married, git house wif grass, color TV's in all the rooms. Precious, She born about the same time as Miz West son that got kilt. You remember him don't you Precious?
Precious looks at a loss.
He born summertime 'bout same time as you.
I was born in November...far as I know.
Yeah yeah thas right. My little Scorpio chile! Scorpio's crafty. I ain' sayin' they lie, jus' you cain't always trust 'em.
Precious looks embarrassed beyond embarrassment.
Ms. Johnston, when did the abuse happen, how often, where? And, when were you first aware of what was going on?

When? I don't know when it start. When I remember it? She still little. Yeah, around three maybe. I give her a bottle. I still got milk in my bresses but not from her but from Carl sucking. I give him tittie, Precious bottle. Hygiene, you know?
(floored)
Excuse me?
Huh?
You mentioned something about hygiene in connection with... Ms. Weiss can't go on.

I bottle her, tittie him. Bottle more better for kidz. Sanitary. But I never git dried up 'cause Carl always on me. It's like that you know. Chile, man -a woman got bofe. What you gonna do? So we in bed. I put her one side of me on pillow, Carl on other side of me. Ms. Weiss looks as if she's stopped breathing. I think thas the day IT start. So he on me. Then he reach over to Precious! I say Carl what you doing! He say shut your big ass up! This good for her. I say stop Carl stop! I want him on me! I never wanted him to hurt her. I didn't want him doing anything to her. I wanted my man for myself -to sex me up, not my chile. Me God damn it! So you cain't blame all that shit happen to Precious on me. I love Carl, I loved him. He her daddy but he was my man! Mary can't help but to shoot a look of anger at Precious while Ms. Weiss pauses to regain her composure...
Precious nods reluctantly.
Lady from Each One Preach One say she got poems too. In fact...
That's enough Mama. That's ... enough. (beat)

You know, I didn't realize what you was until this day -even after all those thangs you did. Maybe I didn't know no better or maybe I just didn't want to but I finally see you crystal clear for the first time. (beat)
I forgive you too. Mary smiles warmly and nods confidently to Ms. Weiss.
...but I'll never see you again. Not even if you dead. Mary's expression drops. Precious turns to Ms. Weiss as M starts to spring up from her seat.
(without looking at her)
Stay down Mama. Mary sits obediently. Precious turns to Ms. Weiss.
I forgive you too. I can tell right now that you ain't qualified for dis kind of mess. Precious thinks a moment and grins a grin that seems much older.
...Precious? I was thinking we might...
I took the TABE test again. This time it's 7.8. Last time it was 2.8.
According to the test, I'm reading around 7th or 8th grade level now. High school level next. College after that.
...Why congratulations Precious. That's ...
Precious stands abruptly, startling both women. She takes step towards her mother. Mary winces. Ms. Weiss looks concerned.
Precious, perhaps it's best if you remain seat...
Precious leans and kisses Mary tenderly on the cheek, tur and gently touches Ms. Weiss' shoulder. Precious takes a good look at them both, smiles and leave the room.
Precious?!
Ms. Weiss calls after her. Precious keeps walking.
Precious!
Precious doesn't stop.
The women run to the window. They see Precious burst out onto the street.
Precious walks down the crowded street carrying Mongo and Andre. She is happy and filled with hope. Tom Cruise is t chatting up another young girl... she pays him no mind.
...for precious girls everywhere.
